Compute credible intervals and confidence sequences

Source: R/intervals.R
cred_int.Rd

Given draws from the posterior and/or prior distributions, compute credible intervals or confidence sequences.

Usage

cred_int(x_post, level = 0.999, param = TRUE)

conf_seq(x_prior, x_post, level = 0.999)

Arguments

x_post

Posterior draws or rvar object

level

Credible/confidence level

param

If TRUE, compute intervals based on a t-distribution fit to the posterior.

x_prior

Prior draws or rvar object

Value

A named vector with lower and upper elements

References

Waudby-Smith, I., & Ramdas, A. (2020). Confidence sequences for sampling without replacement. Advances in Neural Information Processing Systems, 33, 20204-20214.

Examples

prior = rnorm(1e3, 0, 2)
post = rnorm(1e3, 0, 1)

cred_int(post, level = 0.95)
#>     lower     upper 
#> -1.912321  1.879794 
conf_seq(prior, post, level = 0.95)
#>     lower     upper 
#> -3.039564  2.991801
